page.title: 16TOURISM IN HARPUR HILL
page.content:
Our survey area isn't the most likey area of Buxton for tourists but 19th century directories of Buxton recommended a trip to{Diamond Hill}to find 'Buxton Diamonds';these were large perfectly formed crystals. It doesn't look a very interesting place.
A little further north, near Ladmanlow, is the road down to{Grin {Low quarry.}Now this is used as a {caravan site}run by the Caravan Club. It is their top grade of site with a toilet block and electric hook-up. It was opened in{1983}and has space for {100}caravans. It is usually full at Bank Holidays and it is a good idea to book in the summer (Buxton 77735). People can also stay at{Staden Grange and{Foxlow Farm.
